event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Power down the SCA4000 card and remove the zeroize jumper from the adapter (rsrc) identified in the fmdump(1M) output as instructed in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Board Installation and Users Guide.

If the zeroize jumper is still detected after being removed, schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected adapter.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager has determined that the zeroize jumper was detected on the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 card which requires repair action.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:  %MSGID% indicates diagnosis has determined that the zeroize jumper is installed on an SCA4000 PCI adapter. The SCA4000 (vca) driver will not attach until the jumper has been removed.

After removing the zeroize jumper, the network and cryptographic accelerator interfaces may be brought back into service using the fmadm(1M) command:

fmadm repair <EVENT-ID>
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The card cannot be used for administrative or operational purposes.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The driver will not attach until the jumper has been removed.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Zeroize Jumper Detected
